abstract.p: Tom Macklin letter lauds reader reaction to David Thomson's June 11 article on filmmaker Robert Altman's 1970's films, particularly The Long Goodbye (S)

block.p: I thought I was fading into the past almost at breakneck speed, becoming more distant and passe every day. Trying to brake the fall, I prepared to show ''The Long Goodbye'' in class, trying to figure out how to rationalize my self-indulgence, when David Thomson's paean to Robert Altman appeared in Arts & Leisure [''Robert Altman's Decade of Astonishments,'' June 11]. What made me gleeful were the letters that followed two weeks later. A debate in 2000 about Altman's ''Long Goodbye''! The 1970's live!
